newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's MKB Securities to trade German bonds.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's MKB Securities to trade German bonds.

text.p: Hungarian brokerage MKB Securities will offer German bank bonds to its clients, initially limited to bonds in Bayerische Landesbank Girozentrale, MKB officials told a news conference.
"This is evident due to the bank's ownership," said Miklos Jasper, General Director of MKB Securities, unit of the BLB-controlled Magyar Kulkereskedelmi Bank group.

MKB Securities is ready to diversify its offer to include securities from other countries of the Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) later, but the German focus will remain, economist Zoltan Rendek told Reuters. @
Hungary's membership to the OECD in March paved the way for Hungarians to invest in foreign securities.

Hungary opened its market from July 1, 1996 to state bonds issued by the governments of OECD members and the bonds and shares of companies registered in OECD countries which hold the highest category credit rating in any of five large international credit rating agencies.
So far two other securities houses have announced that they were offering foreign papers to Hungarian investors. @
Bank Austria-GiroCredit Investment started trading stocks of AAA-rated foreign companies, while Creditanstalt Securities launched CA Foreign Currency Bond Fund which will invest in government bonds.
